Posts.Content: I had a lumpectomy and axillary dissection and my armpit, half my breast, up the outside of my arm and my elbow are still very numb....this was in Febr.  Does the numbness go away???  I HATE the feeling!!  My armpit seems to rub and feel like I have a log underneath it!!  My whole arm gets so tired and sore.....  I'm feeling very defeated about this whole process, seems like (so far) nothing has gone "right"!!  No luck..........
Posts.Title: Does the numbness under the arm, etc., go away????

Posts.Content: Hi, I have IDC, T2b(2.1 cm)N1(mi)/13 and E+, P+ Her-.  I had a lumpectomy and axillary dissection.  I had a CT/PET scan that showed I had an infection (abcess) in the area where the drain tube had been, also in a part of the incision in my breast.  Hadn't felt too well, but thought that was just part of it all.....  I was taken back into surgery and had the wounds cleaned out, was on IV antibiotics for 3 days and oral for 14.  I, now, go into my Dr.s everyday to have the wounds packed (on my 24th day!).  I can't have any other treatment until I am all healed.  I happened to read a copy of my scan, and found an area that listed I had several hypermetabolic subpectoral lymph nodes that were indeterminate for metastases or infection related - this FREAKED me out some......  My Dr.s did not mention this to me AT  ALL!!  Has anyone else had an experience along these lines???  Not sure what to do or think....Thanks for any help.
Posts.Title: IDC, Lumpectomy and now staph infection!!

Posts.Content: I had a mammogram in about Oct. (this was in 2009) and I was told everything was great.  In Febr. 2010, I found a lump on my own, went to the Dr., she sent me for a mammogram - nothing showed.  The woman doing the mammogram told me she was going to ask my Dr. to prescribe an ultrsound (she could feel the lump!) - that didn't show anything - so the woman, again, ask my Dr. to O.K. an MRI and, there it was, plain as can be, a lump on my left breast located about 3 o'clock....it was very close to the outer surface of my breast!  Seems crazy that if a Dr. can feel the lump but when you have 2 mammograms and an ultrasound and the lump doesn't show - but they STILL can feel it - that there wouldn't be SOMEONE that says try an MRI...........  That persistent tech I had probably saved my life (so to speak).  I went on to have a biopsy and, sure enough, I had breast cancer...  Please, be a little persistent - talk to your Dr. and ask, specifically, if you can have an MRI, for your sake - you really can't just wait, if it is a cancerous tumor you need to get it taken care of!!  If your Dr. won't agree, go get a second or third opinion - it's your body, it IS a big deal.  Good luck to you!!
Posts.Title: Anyone diagnosed with cancer after negative mammo and ultrasound?

Posts.Content: Wondering if you could have some plastic surgery on the left breast to do a little "uplift" and, possibly lipo for a smaller look??  Maybe then a prothesis would work better.  I had a lumpectomy on my left breast that ended up becoming infected with staph.  I had to have more surgery done to help clean out the infection and spent probably 5-6 weeks having the incision packed so it would heal from the inside out.  This left me with a breast that pulled toward my underaram and had a very ugly divet type scar.  The plastic surgeon I had removed the scar and formed my breast into a more normal shape.  This left me with two VERY different sizes!!!  The plastic surgeon then liposuctioned a lot of fat and tissue from my right breast and now they match pretty well!  I was amazed at how much they can do - and very appreciative.  At the time of all this, I was 60 years old + YES I cared about how I looked and felt.  SO, hope you get the help you need - it's out there.  Good luck ;)
Posts.Title: Uneven breast

Posts.Content: Hi!  I've been through 14 months of breast cancer everything - from diagnosis, MRI's, scared sh**less waiting for news, biopsy, 4 surgeries, infections, chemo, radiation, hair loss, exhaustion, depression, the "crazys" from Arimidex (I DO NOT take THAT anymore - 3 months drove me to suicidal thoughts!!) - the whole 9 yards...  Tomorrow I'm going into the hospital and (I hope!) a very good plastic surgeon is going to remove some very bad scarring and (crossing my fingers) "even me up"!!!  I have had bad pain in the area where I had my infection and where it left a lot of scar tissue and the Dr. is going to try to loosen up the scars and lessen the pain I am having.  I, also, have keloids (sp)?? where the port was placed and removed - been sore, red, raised, itchy since October - that is coming off, too.  Surgeon says it is fixable!!  I can't sleep tonight, way too tense, been through a lot and I want this to be the END game!!!!  I have had a 3 month and a 6 month checkup that included an MRI, and all looks good, so I am really scared, but anxiously ready!!  Wish me luck!!  My whole life has been spread out all over this site for over a year.  I have had great, helpful, compassionate people that have given me support and good advice or just prayers!  Thank you all, good luck to you all!!  Hugs.....Sher
Posts.Title: Re-construction Surgery!!!!!!!!

Posts.Content: On Jun 12, 2014 10:48 PM Akitalover11 wrote: I couldn't agree with you More! I remember before BC nurse telling me my estrogen levels off the chart. I did eat a lot of soy and was on prempro for a short time. I wish I knew then what I know now. My son is a wellness expert, holistic healing through nutrition and supplements, herbal tinctures. I always had soy whey protein in my smoothies too. Have you ever heard of leaky gut? Every disease starts in our guts. No, I have never heard of "leaky gut"???  What IS it??  Curious to know.  I LOVE that - before "BC"!!!  I do that all the time - "BC" (before cancer) and then "AC" (after cancer)......
Posts.Title: Are you Estrogen positive Breast cancer and think you know what caused it?

Posts.Content: I have felt all along that my breast cancer was from "everything I did wrong" according to the LIST!!  I never had children, I was obese for years, I used estrogen replacement, I drank alcohol.........lol..........I felt like I didn't have a chance!!  Anyway, I am into my 4th year, now and took Arimidex for 1 month.  That was far worse then any of the chemo or radiation treatments I had!!  I was literally "nuts" - I felt like I was going through another horrid menopause.  I experienced about all the symptoms, plus extreme panic, that there is for menopause.  My Onc told me it wasn't worth it to live that way, so I quit the drug (thank GOD).  I worry sometimes that I may have had a better chance with taking the drug, but so far so good, and I feel so much better without it.  I guess it's all in what a person can tolerate and still go on with life.  My family had NO breast cancer, so I got to be the first - lucky me!!  I DO think my life style made a big difference in my diagnosis......
Posts.Title: Are you Estrogen positive Breast cancer and think you know what caused it?

Posts.Content: !THAT IS SICKENING TO ME!!      Why do we not "sexualize"  male breast cancer, prostate cancer, penile cancer?????  It's a devistating disease not a bunch of "fore-play" - Lord!!.........
Posts.Title: What do you think about ads that sexualize cancer?

Posts.Content: Good for you!!!  ONE less thing, now, to worry about.  Glad to hear you found a Dr. that has enough sense (and gumption) to pay attention to your concerns.  Luck to you!!!!!
Posts.Title: mammogram at a young age?!? dr. said NO!

Posts.Content: WOW!!  I would change Drs, too!!  Seems insane not to take your concerns seriously, especially if you found a lump (small or not - THINKS it's a gland or not!!), AND especially if you have a cancer recurrence???  Go out and find a Dr. that will ease your mind, get a GOOD "breast exam" and a mammogram.  GEEZZZZ, Drs.............  The mammogram can be hard to read on anyone, any age (I'm 60) if you have "dense" fibrous breasts - but it is still a good starting tool for discovering inconsistencies.  Radiologist found a lump that did not show up very well on a mammogram, but looked "suspicious" and could be felt, so they did an ultrasound to check it out.  Good thing they did, I had breast cancer!!!  Do whatever it takes to get someone to pay attention!!!  Good luck!!  Let us all know what transpires.
Posts.Title: mammogram at a young age?!? dr. said NO!

Posts.Content: I had a lumpectomy and then an infection in the drain area and breast incision last Febr. 2009.  I have had a lot of pain in the breast AND under my arm "from the inside out" - that is a good expression.  The top layer of my skin still feels numb, but if I push or rub (even gently) it hurts underneath!!  Mine feels a little like an electric shock ?? in the nerves....hard to explain.  I'm told it just takes "time" - keep wondering how long "time" is - as nerves regenerate very slowly.....  I was, also, told by my surgeon that it could be the scar tissues pulling..........who knows???  I'm thinking about having some scar and tissue removal to see if it will HELP??!!  Nobody can really answer my question!!  Would be nice to hear from someone that this has happened to and if it DOES go away, and what did they do to help???  I keep doing my exercises to stretch the tissues, helps some.  Good luck and hope to see another post that you found the answer!!!!!!
Posts.Title: Bi-Lateral Lumpectomy/mastectomy with immediate reconstruction. 2 weeks post op with pain in both breasts.

Posts.Content: I just had a chemo port placed under the skin up close to my collarbone.  It is very painful, red, bruised and bumps out quite a ways from the skin - you can definitely "see" it!!  I realize this is just the 2nd day, but has anyone ever had a port like this, or any strange reaction??  All I can think of is this has to stay in for 4 months - it sure better get "better" then it is now!!  Does it hurt when the IV line for the chemo is put into the port???  Sure could use some input on these "ports"!!  Thanks.........
Posts.Title: Chemo Port

Posts.Content: Since I posted about he port, I have had an ultrasound to make sure it is O.K..  It seems fine, now and have used it twice now whitout any troubles.  The first time it was used it burned so badly that they had to use a vein to finish my chemo - not THAT was not comfortable - had a huge black, green, blue mark on my arm for 2 weeks or more.  SO, the port is a GOOD thing.  Thought maybe it had been accesed incorrectly or was pulling stitches or scar tissue the first time.  I hate the thought of having to leave this thing in for radiation, also, thought maybe it would be removed afer chemo........  Anyone able to get theirs out after chemo before radiation????  Thanks, Sher
Posts.Title: Chemo Port

Posts.Content: Since I posted about he port, I have had an ultrasound to make sure it is O.K..  It seems fine, now and have used it twice now whitout any troubles.  The first time it was used it burned so badly that they had to use a vein to finish my chemo - not THAT was not comfortable - had a huge black, green, blue mark on my arm for 2 weeks or more.  SO, the port is a GOOD thing.  Thought maybe it had been accesed incorrectly or was pulling stitches or scar tissue the first time.  I hate the thought of having to leave this thing in for radiation, also, thought maybe it would be removed afer chemo........  Anyone able to get theirs out after chemo before radiation????  Thanks, Sher
Posts.Title: Chemo Port

Posts.Content: Sabine.....I UNDERSTAND........I felt such shock when I was diagnosed with IDC that I'm not sure I could even tell you what I was "told, advised" about ANYTHING let alone treatments!!  I haven't thought of much else, cried unconsolably......and looked up everthing I could find on my condition on the net, in books, on-line sites - you name it.  I am still confused, but I have compiled a big list of questions and just made an appointment with my Oncologist again to get more info - feeling slightly more level headed and hoping I can get and "retain" more this 2nd time!!  Good luck with your choices and "hopefully" as some time goes by it will get easier....I'm sure hoping so!!  God bless, and give you peace and guidance.  Sher
Posts.Title: confused.. about treatments..

Posts.Content: I have had my first checkup since my breast cancer treatments have ended, and I really DO NOT understand the meaning or indication of "cancer markers"????  My Dr. hasn't explained this to me very well, and tells me that he tends to go by the way a person is feeling, etc.  I would appreciate it if someone could explain what this means, what the "markers" and numbers are??!!  Thanks
Posts.Title: Cancer checkups + "Markers"???

Posts.Content: On Jul 29, 2011 6:08 PM Mlfjc7777 wrote: Only Christ can help you and He says, "Anybody who calls upon the name of the Lord will be saved."  Saved from what?  Does salvation only mean from sin.  No, not only does He mean from sin but He also means from everything that is trying to destroy you and depression does just that.  The Lord showed me something that changed my life one day in regards to depression.  He showed me that depression and gratitude can not exsist in a person at the same time and that the cure for depression is gratitude.  Depression is the name of an evil wicked spirit that hammers down upon people.  Gratitude, kicks it's ass right bell to the pit of hell from which it came.  Pick something---anything you can be grateful for, like your mom.  Now thank God for her everyday.  Daily, add something else to the list and you will see a dramatic change in your emotional state of mind.  Expect resistance from your thought life (which is where the evil spirit attacks you) but make a conscious choice to resist back and verbally say, "Thank You Lord for my mother", or the day, your children, pets, job, or the fact that you don't have cancer or that you weren't born in a third world nation where you had to draw water five miles away from home and walk it back in a tin pail on your head daily.  Gratitude destroys depression and only Jesus Christ destroys the works of the devil in a person's life.  You need Jesus Connie.  An honest prayer to Him for help, gets an instant answer.  God bless you, MarionHi! Do you REALLY believe this??? If so, you are a very lucky person......and I am hoping this works for you - and maybe others with as much faith!! I am 61, Catholic (a believer), am about a year and 7 months away from my breast cancer diagnosis, and have suffered with depression and anxiety/panic since I was in my teens. I have tried EVERYTHING - yes, everything - to help treat my problem. I feel, strongly, that this is a dire medical condition and absolutely needs medical treatment and some one to "talk/vent/cry" to and with!! I HAVE "cried out to the Lord" - on my knees, in church, with my priest.......you name it.......hasn't taken care of it yet!! I have been filled with gratitude for so many wonders, people, family, my home, my sweet doggy, flowers, food, beauty.....my life in general.....and, so far it hasn't alleviated my problem. I found a wonderful Dr. that has helped me through these past years with marvelous (I feel "GOD GIVEN") antidepressants and antianxiety medications that some wonderful people (that I am grateful to) that have come up with these life saving drugs - and continue to improve them all the time!!! Pray, call upon the name of the Lord, whatever, but get some good medical help!!!!!! Been there, done that! I even "love" that saying - I've been dead for a long time, I just haven't died yet - Lord that is SUCH a true statement when you are in the depths of depression...................reach out, reach out, keep at it, get help - it IS OUT THERE!!
Posts.Title: thoughts on depression

Posts.Content: I found this interesting that the question of what to wear for a bra seems SO relevant to our situations, but rarely addressed!!  Nobody told me anything about what to wear or not wear.  I ended up buying soft cotton (no lace, etc) sleeveless camisole type t-shirts (Fruit of the Loom!!).  They cover, give slight support but do not irritate the areas of scar tissue I have from my surgeries and port - and I feel "covered", I would guess more modest!!!!!   Probably never wear a "real" bra again!!
Posts.Title: Bra suggestions following lumpectomy

Posts.Content: On Jan 14, 2009 12:00 AM Shemay wrote: I just received this link today and feel it is important information that needs to be passed along........................ Researchers Singer and Grismaijer observed 4,500 women and their bra wearing practices. An amazing 3 out of 4 women who wore their bras 24 hours per day developed breast cancer. Women who wore their bras more than 12 hours per day had a 1 in 7 chance of getting breast cancer. 1 out 152 women who wore their bra less than 12 hours a day got breast cancer and an incredibly low 1 out of 168 women who rarely or never wear a bra developed breast cancer. Source: http://www.NaturalNews.com/z025315.html "" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">http://www.NaturalNews.com/z025315.html " target="_blank" rel="nofollow">http://www.NaturalNews.com/z025315.html WOW!!!!!!!!  I am THE 1 out the 168 women who rarely or never wear a bra that developed breast cancer!!!!!   Sure does suck when odds seem to be THAT good...............  I was told the odds are 1 in 8 women "in general" will develop breast cancer........
Posts.Title: Bra suggestions following lumpectomy

Posts.Content: WOW!!  You are so blessed to have such a wonderful faith and attitude!!  I had breast cancer in 2010 and I, truly, felt my life was over......  I would have loved to have had something like you have in your heart - trust in God!!!  I made it through, feel pretty good, have a side effect or 2 - mostly underarm numbness and some lasting pain - but, generally, I have come to a more accepting place in life and I do not think about my "plight" with cancer as often or as fearfully as I once did.  I still worry about a re-currence.....it's been just 3 years.....but I'm not paralyzed with fear.  Thanks for such a sweet HELLO! and you, also, have a blessed and beautiful day + GOOD LUCK with what comes your way.
Posts.Title: stopping by to say hello!

Posts.Content: I'll be starting chemo May 10th for breast cancer and am very, very uncertain if I'm doing the right thing.....  I am scared of all the side effects I hear about and am getting more and more anxious as the time gets closer.  Go in to the hospital the 29th for a Port-a-Cath and not even too sure about that!!  Keep wondering what I got myself into and what happened???
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo Soon.....SCARED!!!

Posts.Content: Thank you very much for answering my question.  I really appreciate the explanation!!!
Posts.Title: Cancer "Markers"??

Posts.Content: Please, I would REALLY like to know if anyone knows much about the meaning, ranges, etc. - anything when it comes to the cancer "markers" in blood tests???????????!!!!!!!!  It seems to be a vague subject and hard to find definitive facts about.  My Dr. doesn't talk about this much - says he put more faith in the way I'm feeling..........
Posts.Title: Cancer "Markers"??

Posts.Content: I am still "experiencing" my breast cancer story!!  I found out about my cancer in Febr. 2010 and am still in somewhat of a denial, still scared, still feel like CANCER is a definite death sentence...... I have had a lumpectomy, a terrible bout with staph infection, another surgery, misery under my arm from lymph node removal, am on my 6th chemo (coming up Tues) of 8 and then 33 radiation treatments AND then God only knows what!!!!!!  I am on a lot of anti-depressants but still feel horribly despondent, cry and worry a lot, wonder "why"???, can't seem to get my head around all of this.  My life is basically "on hold" while I go through this whole process, and I feel that "at least" I will know what I will die of - maybe not now, but eventually - I am pessimistic about the "cure" thing!!!  Out of the 11 people I've known that have had various cancers only 1 has survived 4 years - the others have died from their cancers - I'd say the odds suck.......
Posts.Title: Please share your breast cancer story.

Posts.Content: On Jan 05, 2012 11:13 PM JewelsOhio wrote: I was diagnosed with breast cancer back in September, 2011.  I went through a core needle biopsy, lumpectomy and sentinel lymph node biopsy. I opted for the Oncotype DX Test. The results were steller.  My chances for reoccurace are next to nill. I started Tamoxifen and radiation therapy in December.  And here lies the problem.  I hate the cancer center where I receive my treatments.  I have no other choice but to go there.  I'm stressed to the max.  I cry before radiation, during radiation and on the way home from radiation. The first day it took them over two hours to set up the simulation.  Family members (both male) of a technician came into the room during my set up.  Here I am naked from the waste up and strangers are allowed to come and go as they please.  I was mortified. I told the doctor and that was as far as it went.   My second visit I found out that two of the meds I'm on shouldn't be taken with Tamoxifen.  I printed the information off of the internet and asked the doctor about it.  She told me that I have to take it up with the doctor that perscribed it to me.  She told me that I need to stay off of the internet then walked away. I've been wheelchair bound for a year now.  One time after the treatment I was scheduled to see the doctor for my weekly visit.  The technician got me into the wheelchair, threw my clothes on my lap and proceeded to take me into the exam room with no gown on. I yelled at her and she said, sorry I forgot; chuckling. What do I do to survive this? I think that is just horrible!!!!  It's bad enough we have to cope with "Cancer".......that's certainly hard.....but to be treated with such little regard!!!!!!??? - that's cruel and I would hate my center, also.  I probably would have not done much when I was first diagnosed as I was so shocked and scared I walked around like a zombie!!  But, now???  I think I would be screaming and yelling at everyone....GEEZ....how would these "so called" professionals like it it they (or their loved ones) were treated so casually???  Can you talk to your primary Dr. or your Onc.???  I was sssssssssooooo blessed with a super, very compassionate Oncologist.....now my surgeon was another story!!!!!  Good luck and try to stand up for yourself as best as you can.
Posts.Title: How To Cope?

Posts.Content: Could you explain what "research" you are referring to??  What do you do with the apricotpits/vitamin B17????  I always thought that apricot pits were poisonous!!  I would be very interested in knowing what this is all about??
Posts.Title: apricotpits / vitamin B17

Posts.Content: I think this is one of the nicest ways to honor your friend that I have seen in a long while!!  Sorry about losing you best friend - hurt for a long time.........  Hope you get LOTS of other bakeries to participate - or ANY other business for that matter!!  Good luck!!
Posts.Title: A challange

Posts.Content: Didn't think it could be true, but sure finding out there is "chemo brain"!!  I can't remember why I go down the stairs half the time or for what??  Making many trips for just one thing anymore - get very distracted, also.......seems weird.  Make lots of lists!!
Posts.Title: Chemo Brain

Posts.Content: Anyone having bone pain from Neulasta shots after chemo??  I have had 5 shots, so far, and this last one has seemed to cause a lot of bone pain in my long bones and especially my knees!!  Seems weird I'd start having pains, now!!  Feels a lot like "growing pains", and is very irritating.  Any suggestions on relief??  HELP!!
Posts.Title: Neulasta
